alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:11PM PDT until June 17 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon and Washington... Columbia River at Vancouver affecting Multnomah and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Columbia River at Vancouver. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect flooding of some islands and low areas, with minor impacts for parks and trails along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:42 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM PDT Wednesday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood between 15.9 and 16.0 feet tonight and Thursday morning, then range between 15.4 and 16.1 feet Thursday afternoon through Friday. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks or on flooded trails. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 300 PM PDT.
